results.title: In the crash
results.creator_credit: Leo Trachtenberg, Roger Reidy, Insurance Institute for Highway Safety and Harvest Films
results.brief_description: Despite ‘accident prevention’ campaigns, millions of cars continue to crash each year. This documentary argues that legislation needs to be introduced to address better safety standards in car and highway designs. Uses footage of highway crashes, controlled safety tests, and potential highway hazards to demonstrates how injury and property damage can be reduced through design. Demonstrates features designed to reduce personal injury such as seat belts, air bags, laminated windscreens, padded daashboards, shock absorbing steering columns, anchored seats and head rests. Also looks at highway design, demonstrating good and bad examples of traffic islands, barriers, signage poles and lamp posts.

results.title: In the company of whales
results.creator_credit: Robin Brown, TVNZ, Channel Four Television and Discovery Networks
results.brief_description: Narrated by Jessica Tandy, this visually stunning documentary shows phenomenal encounters never before captured on film. Whales are enormous, powerful creatures with extraordinary grace and intelligence. They are masters of a watery realm where they have existed for more than 30 million years. Filmed in 15 locations off the coasts of five continents, this affords a comprehensive look at whales (Blue, Sperm, Right, Beluga, Bottle-nosed whale and their small relatives the dolphin) and their environment. Guided by one of the world’s leading Cetacean experts, Dr. Roger Payne, a team of underwater cameramen reveal the mysteries of whale song, their sophisticated navigation techniques, their remarkable intelligence and affectionate social behaviour emphasising that they really are the gentle giants of the deep.

results.title: In the company of men
results.creator_credit: Neil LaBute, Stephen Pevner, Mark Archer, Fair and Square Productions and Atlantis Entertainment
results.brief_description: This lacerating black comedy is an acerbic commentary on modern day masculinity. Two businessmen, sent by their company to oversee new company offices in another city, undertake a scheme to enact revenge on contemporary women. They plan to find a woman, wine and dine her, seduce her and then cruelly dump her. From this initial premise Neil Labute crafts an exceptionally taut and challenging work which explores the misogyny, racism and selfishness that underlies the competitive ethos of the new yuppie capitalist culture. Aaron Eckhart gives an outstanding performance as Chad, who imbues his vile character with a disturbing attractiveness. He is ably supported by Matt Malloy as his best friend who allows his personal morality and ethics to be subsumed by his desire to be “one of the boys”; and by Stacy Edwards as the “victim” who the men choose to abuse. Filmed in long takes which allow the actors to take centre stage, featuring excellent production design and music, “In the Company of Men” packs a mighty emotional punch. The end suggests that the culture of misogyny engendered by modern corporatism is as destructive on men as it is on women.

results.title: In the city
results.creator_credit: Nandor Jenes, Donald Batchelor and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Looks at the life of a young English migrant living in an inner city area of Melbourne. Shows him at school, at home, at work in his part-time job selling newspapers and at the Newsboys’ Club. Presents a glimpse of Melbourne in the mid-60’s when city people appear to be pressured by time, living on top of each other while Australia has so much wide open space to offer. In families, everyone helps, but time unfortunately waits for no-one.

results.title: In the bush [Greek Version]
results.brief_description: This film provides a view of some unique Australian birds and animals. In particular, the platypus, echidna, kangaroo and koala in natural surroundings. Commentary in Greek language only - no subtitles. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: In the beginning. Part I
results.brief_description: Sir Kenneth Clark discusses Egypt and the Nile valley. Shows him travelling there and pointing out the ways isn which Egypt flourished as an early civilisation. Presents the art and architecture of that early time. Part I of a two part series. Suitable for upper secondary level. NB: Part II (reel 2) is missing

results.title: In the beginning
results.brief_description: A colourful clay animation film which satirizes society and its impulse to invent nuclear weapons which cause self-destruction. Looks at the invention of destructive weapons from raspberries to rockets! Narration: Brian Woods. Animation: Mark D’Arcy-Irvine, Masfufah Sani. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: In the beginning
results.brief_description: An educational film taking as its starting point “All animals come from the egg”. Depicts with photography and diagrams, ovulation, fertilisation and early cell division of a rabbit embryo. Having depicted a number of scenes of dissection/vivisection, the film concludes with some footage of live animals and a human baby.
